columns.text: In this problem, we need to identify the best way to deal with the risks of a business using the concept of futures options, call and put options.

**a.** Since the breakfast cereal is produced using corn, then the company is exposed to the changes in prices of corn. Since the price of corn is expected to increase in the next month, the company can buy **call options**. We can recall that a call option allows the company the option to buy the product at a certain price. 

First, we need to solve for the number of contracts for this transaction. We know that each contract is for $5000$ bushels therefore, we will divide the number of bushels we have by the contract size:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{number of contracts}&=\dfrac{145,000}{5,000}\\
&=29
\end{aligned}$$

There will be $29$ contracts.

Based on the table, the settle price for corn on that month is $369.50$ or $\$3.695$. We will then get the price by multiplying the number of contracts to the current price and to the number of bushels per contract.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Price}&= 29 \times 5000 \times \$3.695\\
&=\$535,775
\end{aligned}$$

The locked in price is $\$535,775$

**b.** The loss/profit can be using the same formula in Step 2, but we will substitute the future price from the current market price


To do this, we will simply take the number of contracts and multiply it to the number of bushels per contract so that we will get the total quantity of corn in bushels. After that, we will multiply it to the difference in prices. 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Profit/loss}&= 29 \times 5000 \times (\$3.690 -\$3.695)\\
&=-\$725
\end{aligned}$$

There will be  a loss of $\$725$

Since the prediction that the price will increase by May is not true, then a loss is expected. However, the only loss is the amount of premium that was paid to buy the call option. 

If the price does increase in May, then a profit will be secured since the call option to buy at a lower price will be exercised and the amount of premium that was paid will be offset by the profits made.
